item.title: Hash Server 9000 in Go
item.description: I took an internal dev challenge at work a while back because I wanted to learn more Go since I have an OO background and was not familiar with the procedural way of thinking. The goal was to build a simple non-persistent password hashing service using only the standard library while demonstrating the use of concurrency with the endpoint requirements below. Reading the blue and white book was definitely key to gaining deeper insight.
